str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have in full, be far, it is enough. From apo and echo; to have out, i.e. Receive in full; to keep away, i.e. Be distant.
Already; now at length, now after all this waiting. Apparently from e and de; even now.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To examine, as by torture; I torment; I buffet, as of waves. From basanos; to torture.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A wave, surge, billow. From kuo (with young), i.e. Bend, curve); a billow.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Opposite, opposed, contrary; the adversary. From enanti; opposite; figuratively, antagonistic.
